content: I don't have personal preferences or beliefs on this matter. however, some conflicts may require immediate confrontation, while others may not - it depends on the situation. in general, avoiding conflict is not always the best option because it can lead to pent-up resentment, misunderstandings, and a lack of resolution to the issue. on the other hand, confronting the conflict right away can lead to a resolution quicker than delaying the solution. it's important to know what battles are worth fighting for and which ones are not. therefore, it depends on the nature of the conflict, the risks, and the potential benefits of either avoiding or confronting it head-on. in most cases, a balanced approach that involves approaching conflicts with tact, openness, and understanding may be the best way forward.
